titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Brooklyn property records 1979.022
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:14:49 +0000.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Brooklyn Historical Society (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.)

did.abstract: The Brooklyn property records cover the period circa 1600 to 1929 and measure 0.42 linear feet. The bulk of the collection originates from the 19th century. The collection gathers together various deeds, leases, mortgages, and title abstracts for properties located in Brooklyn, N.Y. Most of the title abstracts and some of the other documents include plot maps that clearly show the location of the property in question.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: An item-level inventory of documents in the collection is available in the Othmer Library's reading room. Please contact library staff for more information.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The source and date of acquisition for this collection are unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1979.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn property records, 1979.022, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.
